channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Hospital coronavirus admissions were over-reported at peak of pandemic
item.description: The Government's Science Advisory Group for Emergencies (Sage) found that patients were categorised as Covid-19 hospital admissions if they had ever tested positive for the disease.

item.title: Headmasters could appeal GCSE results for being TOO GENEROUS
item.description: Schools in England may challenge the high marks awarded to pupils after figures released by Ofqual showed that the highest GCSE grades awarded in the country had jumped 26 per cent.

item.title: Covid-era flying review: Heathrow vs Gatwick vs City and BA vs easyJet vs Loganair
item.description: Many people haven't flown in the post-lockdown era and are probably curious about what the experience is like. A fascinating new video by the TPG UK site will lift the veil of mystery around it.

item.title: 5,000 migrants will have already crossed the Channel this year
item.description: Undeterred by the tragic death of a Sudanese man earlier this week, hundreds more migrants are expected to attempt to reach Britain in the coming days, which will take the total over 5,000.

item.title: Flood fears and 'dangerous sea conditions' as Storm Ellen's 70mph gales stir up the high tide
item.description: The Met Office has imposed a yellow weather warning of strong winds stretching across England, Wales and parts of Scotland.

item.title: Half term holiday chaos feared as BA staff 'decide they WILL hold strike ballot over job cuts'
item.description: Cargo, loading and baggage staff agreed to hold a ballot during a mass meeting in Heathrow, London, yesterday. Pictured, passengers boarding a BA plane in Split, Croatia, yesterday.

item.title: UK quarantine list: Croatia, Austria, Trinidad & Tobago added
item.description: In scenes echoing French airports and ferry terminals last week, tourists were seen in their numbers at Croatia's Split Airport last night, as the rush begins to get home by Saturday's deadline.

item.title: Harry Kane misses Tottenham pre-season training due to being in quarantine after holiday return
item.description: EXCLUSIVE BY SAMI MOKBEL: The prolific goalscorer went on a family break to the Bahamas following Tottenham's final game of the season against Crystal Palace on July 26.

item.title: Can YOU find the butterfly among the field of sunflowers?
item.description: Hungarian illustrator Gergely Dudás, better known as Dudolf, shared the seek-and-find puzzle online and challenged puzzlers to uncover the lonely yellow butterfly amid the sunflowers.

item.title: Are these the strangest designs EVER?
item.description: People contributed the strangest designs they've spotted around the world to a gallery on Shareably. Among the bizarre images are a bed with toes and trousers with clear panels on the back pockets.

item.title: Charity hits out in anger at flogging of British ex-public schoolboy in Singapore
item.description: London-born Ye Ming Yuen, 31, was strapped naked to a wooden frame and caned 24 times in Singapore's Changi Prison after a last-ditch appeal against the brutal punishment failed.

item.title: Lee Holmes reveals the ingredients that will boost your mood INSTANTLY
item.description: Nutrition coach Lee Holmes, from Sydney, has revealed the 10 ingredients to eat your way to a better mood including capsicum for happy hormones and rosemary to relieve anxiety.

item.title: Meghan Markle tells female voters: 'If you are complacent, you're complicit'
item.description: The 38-year-old Duchess of Sussex took part in an online summit organized by When We All Vote, a non-profit founded by 'her friend' Michelle Obama.

item.title: Selling Sunset is surprise hit in the UK, writes ALISON BOSHOFF
item.description: ALISON BOSHOFF: When you think of shows starring estate agents, Location, Location, Location and Escape To The Country are likely to spring to mind.

item.title: Hero schoolboy, 11, jumped off pier and rescued toddler 30 yards off shore
item.description: Eli Harrison, 11, didn't hesitate to jump into the water when his family saw the youngster off the coast of Staithes, North Yorkshire.

item.title: Joe Biden accepts Democratic nomination and says Donald Trump has 'cloaked America in darkness'
item.description: Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden called out anger and division in the country as he accepted his party's nomination Thursday - vowing to unite the country .

item.title: PICTURE EXCLUSIVE - Boris Johnson FINALLY breaks cover
item.description: Boris Johnson, fiancée Carrie Symonds, 32, and their baby Wilfred, have been holidaying in a remote three-bedroom cottage on the Scottish coast.

item.title: Government tells universities to 'prioritise disadvantaged pupils' amid A-level grade chaos
item.description: Universities minister Michelle Donelan said once admissions capacity is reached UK institutions should 'where possible try to prioritise those from disadvantaged backgrounds'.

item.title: PAUL THOMAS on... record GCSE results
item.description: 'The bad news is now we're all too smart to invent next year's algorithm'

item.title: My love for a dirty old man! Serge Gainsbourg was 18 years older than Jane Birkin
item.description: In a part-diary, part-memoir, Munkey Diaries, Jane Birkin tells her story. If you're too young to remember the Sixties, you'll have heard of her thanks to the Hermès handbag, Birkin.

item.title: Children's play area on 1970s council estate is among new Grade-II listed places
item.description: A children's slide, designed by landscape architect Michael Brown, on a council estate in Westminster, London, has now been added to the National Heritage List with a Grade II-listing.

item.title: Police launch probe into claims of sex assault at prestigious Scottish ballet school
item.description: The vice-principal of a top Scottish ballet school at the centre of a police probe into grooming claims has stepped down amid concern from former pupils, parents and staff over his conduct.

item.title: Steve Bannon appears in court in HANDCUFFS as he pleads not guilty to $25 million wall scam
item.description: Bannon, 66, beamed with excitement as he emerged from Manhattan federal court on Thursday evening after pleading not guilty to being part of an alleged crowd funded border wall scam.

item.title: Personal trainer, 30, shares her recipe for 'incredibly gooey chocolate brownies'
item.description: Personal trainer Sophie Allen has shared her recipe for 'incredibly gooey chocolate brownies' - and they are under 200 calories per slice. The 30-year-old from Sydney makes them with pumpkin.

item.title: Police officer who described searching women as 'good fun' and mocked a dementia sufferer is sacked
item.description: PC William Pope, from Canterbury, Kent, has been dismissed for sending the string of 'unprofessional' and 'troubling' WhatsApp messages over the course of eight months.

item.title: AI pilot BEATS USAF F16 Top Gun in first ever simulator dogfight competition run by DARPA
item.description: The bot, made by small Maryland company Heron Systems, virtually shot down the human pilot - a Weapons School instructor pilot known by his call-sign 'Banger' - in five rounds of mock air combat.

item.title: Only two black officers featured in a UK police recruitment video were actually from BERMUDA
item.description: Superintendents Na'imah Astwood and James Howard are both listed on the Bermuda police force's website as senior members of its force. The video was released late last year.

item.title: Woman fined £50 as car tyre TWO INCHES over parking bay line
item.description: Rebecca Edge, a teaching assistant from Devon, was shocked to be fined £50 for parking with her wheel just two inches beyond the line while out out with her three-year-old twins in Cockington.

item.title: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS reviews last night's TV: How to catch a criminal napping? Turn up before noon
item.description: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS: A special corner of hell should be fenced off for the thieving cowards who prey on the elderly, turning their homes upside-down to steal cash and possessions.

item.title: Music company boss was sick for four days after eating homegrown courgette
item.description: Mike Andrews, 64, joined dozens in the UK who have fallen victim this summer to a rogue batch of poisonous homegrown courgettes, suffering sickness, diarrhoea and even hallucinations.

item.title: Meghan Markle admits she 'didn't know' about the Commonwealth until she joined the Royal Family
item.description: Meghan, 39, spoke of her 'incredible pride' at being able to work with the Queen's charity, which is a growing network of young changemakers across the Commonwealth.

item.title: Estee Lauder cutting 2,000 jobs and closing stores
item.description: Customers stuck at home have bought more skincare and hair products, but the closure of offices and postponed parties mean make-up and perfume brands have floundered.

item.title: Test and Trace: Number of infected patients reached drops again
item.description: NHS Test and Trace figures show 6,616 new cases in England between August 6 and August 12 - an increase of more than a quarter previous week's figure.

item.title: Government has paid private firms £6.5BILLION during COVID crisis as services struggled
item.description: More than 1,200 deals have been done, often without tendering, as ministers scrambled to adapt to the lightning-fast spread of the virus and the economic collapse that followed.

item.title: The 15-minute 'noiseless' workout you can do at home that won't annoy your housemates or neighbours
item.description: An Australian Pilates instructor has shared the 15-minute 'noiseless' workout she swears by for toning your entire body - without disturbing your housemates or neighbours.

item.title: Taylor Swift donates £23k to Tottenham teenager for university
item.description: The singer, 30, made the generous donation to Vitoria Mario who described herself as a 'black 18-year-old with a dream'.

item.title: Would YOU pay £295 for a tiny bag to hold your phone? Fashion giants jump on trend for small bags
item.description: The biggest names in fashion have joined the cult of the miniature designer handbag. John Lewis has seen huge demand for the £295 Mulberry Grain Leather Medium Phone Pouch.

item.title: Body of retired headmaster is exhumed NINE days after being buried by the wrong family
item.description: John Hetford, 89, was mistakenly buried in St Mary's Church near Carlisle, by mourners who had no idea that they had the wrong body. Jimmy McDonald, 90, was meant to be buried there.

item.title: Stunning images battle it out in the weather photographer of the year contest
item.description: The photographs were captured by entrants from around the world and include images showing the impact of weather on humans, cities and natural landscapes.

item.title: TOM UTLEY: My week in a stately home made me yearn for suburbia
item.description: TOM UTLEY: Hilles House - with its lovingly tended 1,000-acre estate - is a wonderful house, built on a promontory commanding views over five counties.

item.title: Coronavirus Scotland: Technician swears during live update
item.description: The frustrated Tay FM staff member let rip during the First Minister's coronavirus update earlier today as he tried to transmit the broadcast from Holyrood, Scotland.

item.title: RICHARD LITTLEJOHN: Lose £££s on Dishi Rishi's 3:4 diet
item.description: RICHARD LITTLEJOHN: Dishi Rishi's 'Money For Nothing And Your Chips For Free' deal has been a runaway success, depending on your point of view.

item.title: Flight prices to Portugal rocket SIXFOLD just hours after country is taken off quarantine list
item.description: Average fare prices to Faro - the airport used by holidaymakers heading to the Algarve - rocketed from just £35 to £190 in the hours after the announcement was made by Grant Shapps today.

item.title: Sudanese migrant Abdulfatah Hamdallah drowned in the Channel after his dinghy burst, friends reveal
item.description: Abdulfatah Hamdallah died after the 3ft dinghy he and a friend were in was punctured by the shovels they were using as oars. Friends told how he fled his home in Sudan as a result of the civil war.

item.title: JAN MOIR: Yes, the lash is horrific, but so is letting killers hide from justice
item.description: JAN MOIR: Surely no civilised person could condone the barbaric sentence meted out to Ye Ming Yuen for drug offences in Singapore.

item.title: Former Uber security chief is charged after 'concealing hack'
item.description: Federal prosecutors on Thursday charged Uber 's former chief security officer, Joe Sullivan, 52, with obstructing justice and concealing a felony over the 2016 hack.

item.title: Jeremy Clarkson reveals 'best ever Who Wants To Be A Millionaire? contestant' wins top prize
item.description: The new series has already been filmed, with one person walking away with £1 million - the sixth millionaire the ITV show has produced since 1998.

item.title: Legendary BBC newsreader Jan Leeming, 78, says paying to watch the channels is a 'waste of money''
item.description: Former newsreader Jan Leeming says her current TV licence will be her last. She will not pay for another next year because she watches very little and it is a 'waste of money'.

item.title: Convenience store sales more than DOUBLE following the COVID-19 pandemic
item.description: Sales at British convenience stores are up eight per cent, compared to the 3 per cent achieved last year, according to market insight experts Mintel.

item.title: Consumer watchdog says seven popular cars need to be recalled
item.description: Which? said the models each have a prolific issue - from faulty batteries to flawed fuel systems - and makers are showing a 'blatant disregard for their customers' by not recalling them.

item.title: TikTok removes 380,000 videos and 1,300 accounts in the U.S. for violating hate speech policy
item.description: TikTok said that it had acted on content such as race-based harassment and that it also had a zero-tolerance policy on organized hate groups;

item.title: MARK ALMOND on the 'poisioning' of Putin critic Alexei Navalny
item.description: MARK ALMOND: Alexei Navalny's family and supporters are in no doubt that a toxin was administered via the tea. He has, after all, been subject to such an attack before.

item.title: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: Queen's English Society bids to drop its royal name...
item.description: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: I hear the Queen's English Society is considering taking the unprecedented step of dropping the royal connection from its name...

item.title: Cap on number of students on medicine, dentistry and veterinary science courses will be lifted
item.description: Applicants to high-cost, competitive medicine, dentistry, veterinary science and teaching courses will be able to enrol this year after the Department of Education pledged more funding.

item.title: Pictured: Cheriegate conman Peter Foster's new shame over alleged million-pound scam
item.description: Peter Foster was arrested by police officers while he walked his dogs on a beach in Queensland, Australia. He is alleged to have run a sports betting scam costing investors tens of thousands.

item.title: Is the game now finally up for Peter Foster?, asks NATALIE CLARKE
item.description: Foster was arrested while he was out walking his two chihuahuas in Port Douglas, Queensland. A month ago he claimed to be writing his memoirs in an act of catharsis.

item.title: Jeff Bezo's Blue Origin delivers 40-foot tall mockup lunar lander to NASA
item.description: Blue Origin brought the 2024 lunar mission one-step closer by delivering its 40-foot tall mockup lander to NASA. The Jeff Bezo's owned-firm was one of three chosen to build a craft to land on the moon.

item.title: Dwarf kitten 'Mowzer,' who is 8" long, finds family home
item.description: Mowzer was born to a feral mother on a farm near Penzance before she was brought into the Cats Protection Adoption Centre in Carnon Downs, Cornwall.

item.title: Hanging out at fast food joints is GOOD for elderly people's brains, study finds
item.description: A new study from the University of Michigan has found fast food joints provided social interaction that helps slow down the mental decline associated with age-related brain diseases.

item.title: Would we all boogie to Boogaloo? That's what ABBA's Dancing Queen was originally called
item.description: There is a moment at every wedding, birthday, and even Tory Party Conference when the opening riff of ABBA's 1976 hit Dancing Queen triggers a stampede to the dance floor.

item.title: BRIAN VINER has picked his most erotic sex scenes
item.description: There may yet be a baby boom as a result of lockdown and couples quarantining together, but in cinematic terms, sex and the pandemic are not happy bedfellows.

item.title: My little girls from heaven... born three years after their daddy died
item.description: Their father David Kelsall - who would be doing the night-feeds and nappy changes if he had been here today, Lucy insists - died before the twins, David and Samuel, were born.

item.title: MAGGIE PAGANO: Coronavirus and the new normal for grocers
item.description: They have done so well with their delivery operations that shoppers have got the taste, and are unlikely to give up the habit any time soon. Research suggests the shift online is irreversible.

item.title: Martin Latham, who has sold books for more than 30 years, explores why we love books so much
item.description: Martin Latham, manager of Waterstones in Canterbury, tells the bookseller's tale. He explores the history of books and packs the memoir with touching and fascinating stories.

item.title: Want to live longer? Get a dog. Just don't walk it to the cake shop, says 84-year-old Norman Lazarus
item.description: Norman Lazarus, an 84-year-old medical professor, gives advice on how to age well. Norman says; take vigorous exercise, get a dog, avoid salt and comfort-eating.

item.title: Susanna Reid and Steve Parish cuddle on date a year after split
item.description: The presenter, 49, put on an incredibly cosy display with the Crystal Palace chairman, 55, as they shared a hug after dining at Indian restaurant Kricket.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg 'testified under oath for two days' as part of FTC anti-trust investigation
item.description: CEO Zuckerberg's, left, testimony could be used to build a case against Facebook. But the move is not said to mean the FTC, headed by Joseph Simons is right, will definitely pursue a lawsuit.

item.title: Heavens above! Vicar with vertigo climbs his church spire to raise repair money
item.description: Reverend Sam Leach conquered his fears to climb his church's 165ft spire in a fundraising feat to pay for repairs. He scaled St Mary Magdalene Church in Torquay.

item.title: Luxury lifestyle of Iraq veteran arrested over We Build The Wall
item.description: Prosecutors allege that Brian Kolfage, a triple amputee and celebrated war veteran, was the main beneficiary of the scheme. He and his wife Ashley live on Florida's panhandle with their two kids.

item.title: The Cabinet of Calm: Paul Anthony Jones's 'linguistic remedies'
item.description: Paul Anthony Jones is a language blogger who believes in the power of words.His aim with this magical little book is quite clear: to cheer us up and calm.

item.title: Players of Microsoft's Flight Simulator are virtually visiting Jeffrey Epstein's private island
item.description: Players of Microsoft's new Flight Simulator game are flocking to Jeffrey Epstein's private island in Little St James, where he allegedly hosted Bill Clinton and Prince Andrew.

item.title: Waitress, 19, hanged herself while on phone to her best friend
item.description: Chloe Davison died at her home in Lanchester, County Durham in December last year while speaking to her friend Lauren Askew.

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle wanted to 'restructure press'
item.description: According to biographer Omid Scobie, the Duke of Sussex, 35, 'had a conversation with senior aides at Buckingham Palace about the press system' for he and the Duchess, 39, last summer.

item.title: Coronavirus: Pfizer's second vaccine has fewer side effects
item.description: After receiving vaccine B1, 50% of 18-to-55 year olds and 16.7% of adults aged 65 to 85 reported reactions compared to 16.7% of the younger group and none of the older group who had reactions to vaccine B2.

item.title: Police hunt airgun shooter as swan found covered with blood
item.description: Police in South London found the injured swan with air pellet injuries in its neck at Southmere Lake near Thamesmead. They said the pellet wound was found on right side of the swan's head.

item.title: Coronavirus: China says Wuhan water party was 'payback'
item.description: Global Times, an English-language newspaper backed by the Chinese Communist Party, has defended a party at Wuhan Maya Beach Water Park which saw thousands pack out the park.

item.title: Julian Assange's partner crowdfunds to fight US extradition bid
item.description: Stella Moris, 37, said he is facing a 'monumental' legal case with 'unthinkable' ramifications, and accused the Trump administration of 'targeting' the WikiLeaks founder. He is held in Belmarsh prison.

item.title: Photos of ex-porn star Ron Jeremy's filthy Hollywood apartment
item.description: A New York woman who met Ron Jeremy in September 2017 in LA said she went to his apartment to use the restroom and was shocked by the conditions he was living in.

item.title: CCTV shows Kent vandal's 30-second fight with a business sign
item.description: CCTV footage shows the young man repeatedly kick and punch the board outside a building company's offices in Herne Bay, Kent, in a bizarre bout which lasted around 30 seconds.

item.title: Royal Navy HQ closed as Legionnaire's Disease bacteria found
item.description: Leach building (pictured), the main part of Navy Command headquarters (NCHQ) in Portsmouth Harbour, is understood to have shut while the bacteria is treated and flushed out.

item.title: Ex-wife of Russian billionaire foiled in attempt to get superyacht
item.description: Tatiana Akhmedov, the estranged wife of one of Russia's richest men who was awarded the £340m super yacht Luna by a British divorce court, has seen her plans to seize the vessel scuppered.

item.title: Alaska's salmon are SHRINKING, according to experts who say climate change is to blame
item.description: Alaska´s highly prized salmon are being impacted by climate change, according to study that found the prized fish has shrunk over the past six years and some are 8% smaller.

item.title: Kelly Osbourne admits to gastric sleeve surgery TWO years ago
item.description: Kelly Osbourne has revealed the secret behind her new 85lb weight loss - gastric sleeve surgery, that she had almost two years ago.

item.title: Newborn baby's body found in Bradford waste recycling centre
item.description: The baby was found at the Bowling Back Lane Household Waste Recycling Centre in Bradford, Yorkshire, earlier today. Police are now searching for the baby's mother.

item.title: Mother who left dying girl, 13, for pub accused her of 'faking'
item.description: Robyn Goldie, 13, had begged her mother Sharon Goldie, of Wishaw, Scotland, to get her medical help in the days leading up to her tragic death, complaining she was 'hurting all over'.

item.title: Strictly's Neil Jones walks dog with new girlfriend Luisa Eusse
item.description: The professional dancer, 38, beamed with happiness as he held Luisa's hand while walking his dog Crumble, whom he shares with his estranged wife Katya Jones, in London on Wednesday.

item.title: Netflix movie Cuties slammed for twerking scenes
item.description: The French movie, which is due to be released on Netflix on September 9, tells the story of an 11-year-old Senegalese Muslim girl who joins a dance group.

item.title: Rapid pregnancy style tests for Covid-19 'while you eat your cornflakes' could be sold for £5
item.description: Sir John Bell, an Oxford University scientist and key Government adviser, said the cheap devices were currently being assessed by scientists at Public Health England.

item.title: Airbnb BANS house parties and limits bookings to 16 people
item.description: Airbnb said it will limit occupancy in its rental homes to 16 people. It comes after several incidents of customers hosting secret gatherings without the host's consent across London.

item.title: Bristol drops diesel-free plan after lockdown led to lower traffic
item.description: Bristol had been told by the government to take drastic action in order to achieve legal air quality levels. But the city's mayor has now said these steps may not be necessary.

item.title: 'Fake psychiatrist' charged with fraud after 22 years with NHS
item.description: Zholia Alemi, 57, formerly from High Harrington, who worked for the NHS for 22 years despite allegedly not having any qualifications, has been charged with 13 fraud offences.

item.title: Train passenger knocked unconscious in row over face masks
item.description: John Adam, 43, (pictured) spent 24 hours in hospital being treated for severe laceration, a severely cut lip and given stitches for a head wound after being punched at Clapham Junction Railway station.

item.title: Writings reveal settlers of the Lost Colony of Roanoke DID integrate with local tribe
item.description: Experts uncovered writings about the Lost Colony of Roanoke that state the group was not killed by natives, but integrated with the tribe - leading experts to say the mystery is finally over.

item.title: Women with faulty BRCA gene have average breast cancer risk of 35%
item.description: The team say a 'polygenic risk score' - a measure of overall genetic variations in a woman's DNA - may provide a better indication of disease risk than the presence of the single mutation.

item.title: The Crown: Series four release date is REVEALED as teaser reveals glimpse of Princess Diana
item.description: The 30-second preview hinted there could be dark times ahead for the monarchy as Olivia Colman's Queen Elizabeth II warns it is 'too important to fail.'

item.title: Premier League remain silent over 14 positive coronavirus tests amid fears that numbers will grow
item.description: The Premier League have remained tight-lipped over the sudden surge in positive coronavirus cases that have been sweeping pre-season training camps since the weekend.

item.title: Greenland ice sheet melted more in 2019 than in any other year
item.description: Experts led from Germany found that the ice loss in 2019 was 15 per cent higher than the previous worst year on record - which was 2012.

item.title: Ancient Egyptians whipped a snake to death by its tail broke a cat's neck to make mummified animals
item.description: Experts from Wales used 3D scans to conduct a digital 'post-mortem' on the embalmed remains of a cat, bird and snake more than 2,000 years after their death.

item.title: Harrow school is launching £15,000-a-year online sixth form
item.description: Harrow School Online will allow sixth form students from around the world to study remotely for A-levels without ever stepping foot inside a physical classroom at its north London campus.

item.title: Girl, 10, with 'growing pains' diagnosed with rare bone cancer
item.description: Amelia Spalding, 10, from Montgomery, in Wales, has begun treatment for an extremely rare bone cancer which was initially dismissed as nothing more than growing pains.

item.title: England records five more coronavirus deaths in the preliminary toll
item.description: Department of Health data released this afternoon show 1,051 Britons are testing positive for the life-threatening disease each day, on average. For comparison, the figure yesterday was 1,043.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: One in eight workers still on furlough
item.description: Chancellor Rishi Sunak has said the scheme will close at the end of October with support starting to be reduced from next month.

item.title: Could Wigan be freed from lockdown? Andy Burnham says it's 'clear' measures have to worked
item.description: Official figures show the city of Birmingham's infection rate has more than doubled over the past fortnight, with around 25 new cases of coronavirus for every 100,000 people.

item.title: Germany records its highest number of coronavirus cases since April
item.description: Germany has recorded 1,707 new cases of the coronavirus in the past 24 hours, the highest daily toll since April, official figures showed Thursday.

item.title: QUARTER of all GCSE pupils get A/A* equivalent grades
item.description: Some 25.9 per cent of pupils received a grade 7 to 9 today, while 76 per cent received at least a grade 4 (C). These figures were both much higher than those last year of 20.7 per cent and 67.1 per cent.

item.title: Girl, 16, is 'gang-raped by 30 men' in an Israel hotel
item.description: Two men have been arrested so far over allegations that the girl was repeatedly assaulted while she was drunk in a hotel room in the coastal resort of Eilat (file photo).

item.title: Furious families of the ISIS 'Beatles' victims slam bungling UK legal system
item.description: Furious families of the 'ISIS Beatles' victims have slammed the UK legal system for 'letting them down' as it emerged Britain STILL can't send crucial evidence to US over 'data protection rights'
item.media:description: FILE - In this March 30, 2019, file photo, Alexanda Amon Kotey, left, and El Shafee Elsheikh, who were allegedly among four British jihadis who made up a brutal Islamic State cell dubbed "The Beatles," speak during an interview with The Associated Press at a security center in Kobani, Syria. The Justice Department has notified the British government that it will not pursue the death penalty against two Islamic State militants suspected in the beheadings of Western hostages, removing a hurdle in the potential prosecution of the men in the United States. The decision, revealed in a letter Wednesday, Aug. 19, 2020, could allow Britain to began sharing evidence with federal prosecutors in the U.S for any potential case against El Shafee Elsheikh and Alexanda Kotey. (AP Photo/Hussein Malla, File)

item.title: Manchester Arena bomber Salman Abedi's brother Hashem is jailed for a minimum of 55 years
item.description: Hashem Abedi (pictured) the brother of Manchester Arena bomber Salman, has been jailed for a minimum of 55 years for his part in the attack that killed 22 people at a concert in 2017.

item.title: A 15-foot ichthyosaur that lived 240 million years ago died after eating a 12-foot long reptile
item.description: The exact cause of death is unknown, according to a team from the University of California, Davis, but fossils reveal the predator died shortly after its enormous meal.

item.title: John Terry is locked in a battle with neighbours over plans to build pool-side party and drinks area
item.description: The former England captain, 39, and his wife Toni, 38, moved into the plush 18th century, seven-bedroom property in Cobham, Surrey last year.

item.title: Murder victim's sister brands E17 Night Stalker 'an absolute pig'
item.description: Aman Vyas, 35, was sentenced to life in prison with a minimum term of 37 years today at Croydon Crown Court, after being convicted of a 2009 rape and murder, as well as raping three other women.

item.title: Police say probe into one-punch knock-out of racist Tube passenger will continue
item.description: Billy Steele was filmed launching a tirade at three black passengers on the Tube before then being knocked unconscious.

item.title: Police are forced to close Curry Mile AGAIN as hundreds ignore local lockdown in Manchester
item.description: Wilmslow Road in Rusholme, known as Curry Mile for its array of South Asian cuisine restaurants, was shut only last week amid similar scenes for Pakistan Independence Day.

item.title: Fossils: Tiny, 48-million-year-old primitive horse that looked like a badger found in German oil pit
item.description: The early equid - dubbed 'Propalaeotherium voigti' by experts - was unearthed from an oil pit located in Messel, near Frankfurt, in southern Germany back in 2015.

item.title: Children are 'silent super spreaders' of Covid-19, scientists claim
item.description: Youngsters can carry larger amounts of the virus than adults, which confers with increased ability to transmit the virus to others, scientists at Massachusetts General Hospital claim.

item.title: Nicola Sturgeon warns Boris Johnson to 'abide by all the advice' on lockdown during Scottish holiday
item.description: Mr Johnson, 56, his 32-year-old his fiancee and their three-month-old son are expected to go to Scotland for a 'paternity holiday' next week that could reportedly include some time camping.
